item.title: Report E-2025030042
item.description:
Report E-2025030042

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-05T18:18:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-28
  • City: KATY
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 28, 2025, five (5) 1-gallon jugs of UN1789 were damaged and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2025020408
item.description:
Report E-2025020408

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-01T21:20:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-27
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 27, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1274 was forked and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 Environmental (E3) to remediate the site. The crew utilized microblaze and placed the damaged drum in one (1) 95-gallon overpack for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025020407
item.description:
Report E-2025020407

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-01T21:20:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-26
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 26, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN3264 was damaged in transit and released approximately four (4) tablespoons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. The crew transferred the product to one (1) new 275-gallon tote for continued shipment. The crew utilized absorbent pads to clean the released product. All waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged tote was staged onsite as waste as well/

item.title: Report I-2025020071
item.description:
Report I-2025020071

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-01T21:20:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-18
  • City: DFW Airport
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was questioned by the security staff at the DFW International Airport. When the box was opened it was discovered that the shipment failed to comply with the following: 49 CFR 173.185(b)(2)(ii) There is a potential violation of 49 CFR 173.185(b)(7) being packed with a heat warmer.
